The offerings were simply awful...watery eggs, dry potatoes, poorly laid out (folks are bumping into each other). This hotel is pet friendly. Summary: Don't stay here it's outdated, looks and feels unclean. Reminds me of a super 8 motel where you pay by the hour. The front desk is not friend and not helpful. Don't bother asking for any thing - you'll never get it.  I recommend that you bring your own sheets, pillows and Clorox wipes if you have to stay here.
Manager Response: none

Summary: After a 4 hour drive from Las Vegas, my wife and I checked in to this hotel. We were told that we were "upgraded". We happily went to our room and were stunned to find that we were placed in a handicapped room! I am extremely tall and the shower comes up to my chest. Not practical or comfortable to take a shower. We immediately asked to switch rooms and were told that there was no vacancy. The person at the front desk did not notify us that this was a handicapped room before hand, nor did she offer to find us another room at another location that we would be comfortable in. Not very good customer service, if you ask me. We are reward members that travel often and we stay at a Marriott location EACH and EVERY time. Summary: Clean comfortable rooms friendly staff (for the most part) and just about everything needed for an very nice extended stay. I loved the full kitchen, and the fact that there is a huge supermarket within walking distance! The free breakfast was good one morning, but lacking the next. The food prep staff seemed oblivious to the needs of the diners. One stepped in front of me (I was the only person in line at the time) and took her time straitening up and refilling the paper plates napkins and plastic utensils. Another staff member removed the half full container sausage links just before I could get one. Since there was no other protein selection on the food bar, I had to wait until she brought it back. It was a little strange.
Manager Response: none

Summary: they took a good thing and made it better!  faster, more reliable wifi!...and free.  did i mention that it was FREE!  how the heck can you beat that...well they do have free breakfast!  wow....you can beat it all...they have a full kitchen!!!!  I stay here 3-4 times per year!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel is very nice-rooms (suites) are very roomy and comfortable. Walking distance to mini mall and movie theater. Easy in and out. Not far from Nixon library which is worth a special visit. Staff helpful and friendly!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Really nice rooms. The bathtub is a little too close to the toilet for my taste but the King size sofa bed room was very nice. I was a little uncomfortable for some reason but that is no reflection on the beauty of the room. The full kitchen was very nice. The appliances are very modern and I would even refer to them as fancy. One closet was small but it's ok, since the closet by the bathroom more than makes up for it. I may not return but the room was fabulous!
Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife and I travel to this area at least two times a year and we always choose to stay at this Residence Inn because of the wonderful service that you get from the staff. In particular for our most recent stay, the assistant manager Gretel was very accommodating in holding my luggages for us while we temporarily had to travel to another part of the country.  While I can see the other reviews talk about the place being dated, and yes the place is due for remodeling, the place is always immaculately clean.  The residence rooms feel very much like home complete with a kitchen, and appliances. My wife and I would always call this our place away from home.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding one of our staff members. I am pleased you enjoyed your stay. Thank you for being our guest.

Summary: This is our second stay at this hotel. The rooms are large and well equipped. Daily maid service is very efficient. Daily breakfast is awesome with different types of egg dishes each day. They also offer oatmeal, cereal, waffles, bagels and such, assorted fruit and muffins. And of course, fresh, hot coffee. The front desk staff  are very accommodating and friendly. This hotel is our home away from home when we are in CA. Very comfortable beds!! We will return again and again when we visit our children in CA.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to evaluate your thoughts on your recent stay. We are all pleased your stay went well and your entire family enjoyed their time at the Anaheim Hills Residence Inn.  We wish you a joyous holiday season and look forward to having you back as our guest.

Summary: The staff is nice and knows the area. Rooms are exactly what you would expect. You don't have to listen to the drone of the traffic on the Anaheim freeway at night and it's located very convenient to the 91, 57 @ 55. Breakfast is not what I have come to like about other residents inn as they do not have all the fresh cooked rather steam trays of food, but still good.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent visit and comments regarding our hotel. We are focus on always providing the best possible stay experience for all of our guest. I appreciate your opinion as we value all guest thoughts, especially from experience travelers.

Summary: The kitchen was fully stocked but there were restaurants, theater and shopping within walking distance.  We also enjoyed the full breakfast, free parking and free wireless internet.  It is a great hotel with a great staff.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent reservation and follow up comments. I am happy you enjoyed our hotel and the many features we offer. we all look forward to seeing you again during your next stay.

Summary: We spent three nights here in October. We enjoyed every aspect of this hotel. The location was quiet, the room was clean, the service was good, the pool/hot tub were enjoyable, and the breakfast was delicious! We will definitely stay here again in the future.
Manager Response: Thank you for evaluation of our hotel. I am very happy your family enjoyed their stay with us. Thank you for taking time to complete the review. We all look forward to having you and your family as our guest again.

Summary: Stay here 3-4 x per year, 5 nights at a pop on visits to So Cal.  This place is a great location close to stores, restaurants, shopping....walking distance!  the staff is super friendly AND they have free breakfast AND free wifi!!  AND a kitchenette!
Manager Response: Thank you for your continued reservations at the Anaheim Hills Residence Inn. I am very happy to hear all of your expectations have been taken care of. I appreciate the comments on our over size rooms and your use on the various amenties of the suite and hotel. We all look forward to having you as our guest for future reservations.

Summary: Residence Inns are one of my favorite hotel brands. The rooms, even the studio, are spacious with full kitchens. It doesn't feel so much like a hotel room. This property is clean and walking distance from 24 hour Fitness, Von's grocery, movie theaters and variety of restaurants. During the week there is an evening social hour with appetizers.  The staff here is friendly and courteous in a typical Marriott fashion.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice hotel! Walking distance to so much!
Summary: This is a very nice hotel. Check in was quick & parking wasn't crowded like at most hotels. Rooms are nice and clean! They supply you with everything for the kitchen which is great!! Movie theater, dining & shopping within walking distance! Very nice hotel. Would definitely recommend!
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay with us. We are fortunite to be very close to many restaurants and other retail stores in walking distance. I am happy you enjoyed your stay and thank you for your kind words on our property. I look forward to having you as our guest the next time your travels brings you in the Anaheim Hills CA area.

Summary: This is the second time I've stayed at this location, and I really enjoy it for multiple reasons. First, the location. It's close enough to be convienent to Disneyland, but also far enough out of the hoopla that it has a more relaxed atmosphere. It's also very centrally located next to shops, grocery stores, restaurants and a couple gas stations. This is very nice as you don't need to wander far off property for whatever you need. The surrounding area is also extremely beautiful and surrounded by nature.  Secondly, I appreciate the size of this hotel. It is well equipt without being so huge that you'd get lost trying to find the pool. While the continental breakfast is busy, it's not so crazy that you can't easily get some food.  Finally, we really appreciate the comfort of the
Manager Response: Thank You for your review during your recent stay with us. I very much enjoy hearing from our guest who have previously have stayed here and do noticed the upgrades we do. I appreciate your comments and will follow up. Thank you for always being our guest.

Summary Heading: Spacious, quiet, well equipped suites if you need to be in the Anaheim/Yorba Linda area of LA
Summary: This Marriott has rooms that are large, clean and well equipped, if a bit dated. Great for singles, couples or small families. Each suite has a very useable kitchen, well equipped with large microwave oven, burners and even a dishwasher and ice maker in the freezer! Great TV with good channel lineup. Free in room WIFI. It is located right next to a large shopping complex with a great supermarket (called Pavilions), Target department store, Movie theatre and many restaurant choices. The included breakfast with hot items as well was well tended to. I have no real complaints. Both I and my friends who had the room next door, really enjoyed their stay. So this is easy to recommend. Enjoy! If you found this review helpful to you please "like it". Thank you.
Manager Response: none

Summary: As the name suggests, you could literally live here. Full kitchen with refrigerator, cabinets, dishwasher (!) and sink. There's a full sized couch and sizable bathroom.  Everything else is pretty minimalist. The pool is pretty small, the lounge chairs suck, and the pool towels are half-sized. I guess it's designed for consultants spending time here for work, but I saw a bunch of little kids at the pool, probably post-Disneyland. There's basically no lobby nor any service staff.  We stayed here due to the affordability and proximity to Angel Stadium, which worked out pretty well. The room was clean and we experienced no problems. Free parking. Free breakfast buffet, which was okay.
Manager Response: Thank You for your recent stay at the Anaheim Hills Residence inn. I am happy you found our room size larger than your typical hotel room. Our staff is always available to assist all guest if there is any service issues. We are very committed in making all guest stays perfect. I look forward to having you as our guest whever your travel plans bring you to the Anaheim Hills area.

Summary: We love this Residence Inn. We've stayed here on a few other trips to SoCal. It's a friendly, clean, well maintained hotel. With a Pavillion's grocery store (Von's/Safeway chain) just across the street - it's perfect.  I cannot thank Kimberly (Ops Manager)enough  for her help during this stay! She was so incredibly kind and helpful as we were dealing with a death in our immediate family.   I will never look for another place to stay when in SoCal and in need of a hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words regarding one of staff members. We strive to be flexible and accommodating , but when those life events occurs we certainly want to assist as much as possible. I will pass on your comments and thank you for your loyalty to the Anaheim Hills Residence Inn.

Summary Heading: Clean, relatively quiet and convenient location.
Summary: We booked a two bedroom, two bath accommodation.  It was plenty of roomy for four of us.  While the location was in a busy area, it was surprisingly quiet.  A short walk across the street found several eating opportunities and a large (Pavillions) grocery store if needed for an extended stay.  The facility was well kept.  We stayed two nights but were busy with family events so did not use any of the facilities (ie. swimming pool).  It looked very nice and well kept.  If you are visiting the Yorba Linda area (i.e. Nixon Library)  this is a very convenient location.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent reservation at the Anaheim Hills Residence Inn. We are very commited in reducing our carbon footprint whenever possible.  Over the years have upgraded a variety of the systems to reduce energy and water waste. One program we are very proud to be a partner in the "Clean the Word" organization in which we recycle our used bars of soap and it get melted down and reformed into a new bar of soap that then gets distributed to other areas in the world of need. In fact for every 2000 lbs of soap we send it translates to one life saved.  I hope to have you as our guest whenever your plans are in our area.

Summary Heading: Great service, comfortable suites and everything you could want
Summary: Lovely stay in this hotel with friendly staff, pool and hot tub. Next to a small mall for all your dietary and shopping needs with some good restaurants too. Recommend this hotel for families as plenty to do around the hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding the Anaheim Hills Residence inn. We think our location is the perfect location for our area in terms of retail shopping, restaurants and close proximity to the Disney Parks and sport venues.

Summary: Our family booked two rooms for a weekend youth volleyball tournament.  Overall, I would stay here again if given the opportunity.  It was probably the most reasonably priced Residence Inn I've booked or ever looked at before.  This would be great multi-night property for families or business travelers. Here are some simple things to note:  Pros:  Freeway close, spacious room, quiet, free breakfast, free parking, stores and restaurants nearby, free basic wifi, very courteous and prompt service and reasonably priced for what you get.  Cons: Cleaning and maintenance were lacking, particularly in the bathroom, at least 20 minutes from most Orange County attractions and the lobby had a very noticeable "B.O." smell every time I went down there.  Suggestions:  They have a self-serve
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice lodging, well-located with lots of shopping, restaurants and highway access close by
Summary: This was my first stay at the Residence Inn Anaheim Hills and I would recommend it to business travelers or families for its great location and roomy accommodations. Lots of dining and retail options very close by. The property is not new but is well-maintained and housekeeping does a very good job. My check-in and check-out were efficient and staff was friendly and helpful. Bedding was comfortable and linens were clean and fresh. I stayed in a king bedroom suite that was spacious with a separate seating area and two TVs.  The morning breakfast offering is varied enough to satisfy most travelers with hot and cold items and beverages. Free parking was a plus and the pool and exercise areas were in good condition. Standard wifi was free and fast enough for me to keep in touch with
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding our property. Residence Inn has many avenues to enjoy refreshments, we do offer our soda fountian selection during our evening RI-Mix events which are generally Monday -Wednesday on most weeks during the hours of 6:00PM-7:30PM.. We always have hot coffee and hot chocolate available 24/7. In addition we have our market stocked with a variety of beverages and tasty food items available for purchase at any time.

Summary: We stayed at this inn for about 4 days. The staff was friendly, rooms immaculate, and location great for daily trips into Anaheim. Wifi never really worked, but otherwise no complaints at all in the stay. there are lots of stores and restaurants right around the Inn, so shopping and getting food is very easy- all within walking distance.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to write us on your stay. We are pleased to be a pet friendly hotel who in partnership with responsible pet owners, we all make everyone's stay a great one. Please go on line the next time your travels take you to Anaheim Hills as we have special Pet Lover rates that waives the pet cleaning fee and you receive a gift for your pet valued at $25.00.

Summary: We stayed here on our last minute trip to Disneyland. Since there wasn't any properties nearby, we stayed here. It was only 20 minutes away. So it wasn't bad. The rooms were clean and the breakfast is your typical free hotel breakfast. We didn't use the pool since our plans were strictly Disney but it seemed clean as we walked by it to breakfast. Their pet policy was reasonable compared to other hotels. We paid $75 for our entire stay. We had our 3 small dogs, and this was the best. If we travel with our lets again, we will definitely stay here. It's near lots of shops and restaurants and easy to get to off the freeway.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: New needed a place to stay while our home was being painted.
Summary: Clean, comfy and conveniently located next to restaurants, shopping , a movie theater and freeway access.  We made the mistake of staying at an extended stay America thinking it was the right choice and ended up checking out a day early. Found this lovely place by chance. It's tucked away, but full of great surprises. It's a home away from home!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I originally picked this hotel based on the reviews and the location.  It turned out better than I had planned. Prior to checking in, I had realized that I had made an error in my reservation dates.  The staff was very quick to help me rectify my error.  The rooms were very spacious, and seemed in very good repair.  We had no issues with either of the two rooms that we occupied.  The one room and the two room suites were both large with plenty of room to work in. The breakfast area wasn't that crouded, and still well stocked, as we chose to eat closer to the end of breakfast. The food was very good as a business man's type of buffet.  Check out was easy,  I will defiantly use this location everytime I am back in this area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is very neat and clean and in a nice area. The bed was exceptionally comfortable. The fitness center was well equipped and clean. The hot breakfast bar was well stocked with eggs, sausage, waffles, home fries..much better than just cold cereal and toast. I would stay there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Evening staff was OK on arrival.  Rooms were nice.  Plenty of restaurants and a decent grocery store nearby.  Internet service was so-so.  Beds were comfy.  In room kitchen worked well.  Breakfast was good, but staff struggled a bit keeping it full.  About a 30 minute ride to Disneyland.  Yorba Linda seems like a nice area.  TV channel choice was well above average.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel and will continue to when I come down to Southern California.  I stayed in the 2-bedroom suite both times as it has 2 separate bedrooms and each has its own bathroom. The bedrooms are located on the sides and then joined in the middle is a spacious kitchen, dinning room table and comfortable couch with a fire place.  Our family went to Disneyland for 2 days and I wanted to keep an eye on my 76 year old mom with out getting in her way or having her in mine.  This suite worked out so well. The free breakfast for each morning was great and the service was wonderful. The hotel is currently working on remodeling all their bathrooms, so you might want to check when this will be done but the stay was WAY less expensive than staying

We began our journey by discovering that the card-access slot on the exterior door to the building took about ten swipes to read the hotel key before allowing us inside.  The shower was running ice-cold.  I called the front desk to inquire, and simply got a: "We aren't aware of any problems" type of answer.  Two phone calls later, we merited a trip from a chip-on-the-shoulder maintenance staff worker.  (He was convinced we didn't know how a shower worked.)  After maintenance showed, he banged-around a bit, got it mostly working, and went his way.  Just to put the icing on the cake, our keys expired at 11am to our door,

Please contact my office directly and I will be happy to speak with you regarding the issues. Thank you for your comments.

Summary Heading: Great hotel in a lovely location
Summary: Currently at this hotel and love it. Shopping plus groceries across the road, lovely area and the bfast is nice too. Any maintenance issues Dealt with straight away and the maintenance dept left us a chocolate in the shape of a spanner which is a nice touch. We will definitely be back!
Manager Response: none

Summary: A good hotel for a family with a limited budget.  A simple but filling breakfast comes with the room. The hotel offers free news papers each morning.  If you are looking for a relaxing breakfast you will not get it here.  There a groups of children and parents getting ready for their day at Disney and the children are excited and loud.   The room itself has an array of dishes and utensils, a two burner stove, microwave, full refrigerator, toaster, coffee pot and full dishwasher.  My room, which was very large, had a hide-a-bed and a queen size bed.  there is a play court outside for children. Just across the street is a shopping center with a major chain's grocery store, at least a half dozen eating places , a Target,  several apparel stores and three banks.    The freeway
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review of the Anaheim Hills Residence Inn. We take pride in always having all of guest completly happy with the service and facilities we provide. Our location as you pointed out is next to quite a bit of stores,restaurants and movie theaters. We stive to have our guest enjoy our breakfast, often we are able to open our meeting room space to create more room and we always have trays and or boxes for guest who want to enjoy there breakfast in there rooms.  We all look forward to your next visit when in the Anaheim Hills area.

Summary Heading: Busy Disneyland hotel. Need better maintenance.
Summary: We stayed here for a week in December. First night there was a plumbing problem which caused a gross backup into the bathtub. Front desk moved us to a room which turned out to be "out of service" according to maintenance staff due to air conditioning malfunction. Poor communication between front desk and maintenance. Front desk moved us to another room. The next day, the disposal machine broke down and caused another backup and leaks. Maintenance was good about fixing and replacing quickly.  This hotel seems to get a lot of business and needs to go on an accelerated maintenance schedule. It's ridiculous three items broke down in three separate rooms during our stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Lovely Hotel in a nice setting
Summary: We stayed here for two nights while visiting Disneyland, nice hotel and only about 25mins to get to Disneyland! Was nice to have a relaxing hotel away from the madness of Disney! Room was very big and spacious, had a separate bedroom and living room. Staff very friendly and got us all checked in nice and early! Would recommend to anyone wanting to be near to disney but to still be able to escape the madness.
Manager Response: Dear lainey3718,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review on your stay with us. I am glad that you were able to find the perfect accommodations that allowed you to visit Disney and at the same time, allow distance from the “Disney madness”. Many families take advantage of the proximity to Disney along with the quiet and calm location.  We appreciate your future recommendations and hope to accommodate you again!  “Suite” Regards,  Kimberly Rosales Operations Manager

Summary: Stayed one night and was very impressed.  Very clean.  Kitchen/living room/bedroom/bathroom were a nice size and very comfortable.  Breakfast was the best buffet I've had at a hotel. Very close to shopping.  View from parking lot was so nice. I would stay here again when in LA area.
Manager Response: Dear DebbieDoll,  Thank you for your review. It is great to see what am enjoyable time  you had here with us. I am glad that you mentioned our shopping plaza just across the way from our property. It makes it extremely convenient for our guests to shop, dine, and enjoy good company.  I hope we see you again next time you stop by the Los Angeles area again.  “Suite” Regards,  Kimberly Rosales Operations Manager

Summary: Ok place  Pros:   Marriott quality, quiet location, good price on weekend  Cons:  not great sound insulation, a bit hard to find, in a shopping center, breakfast wasn't as high quality as I'd expect for a residence inn,  parking spaces a bit narrow and drivers in big honking SUVs don't park their cars well.
Manager Response: Dear ECL,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review on our property. Though I am happy to see you thought our property was both cost effective and quiet, I am dismayed to hear that you had a few unfortunate experiences. Please know that I have discussed these items with the appropriate departments. We take our guest feedback very seriously and take steps to make sure they don’t continue to repeat in the future. Though not all items are easily fixed, we do make sure to approach items in a more proactive way.  Please do not hesitate to contact us for any questions or comments. I hope that we have the opportunity to accommodate you in the future.  “Suite” Regards,  Kimberly Rosales Operations Manager

Summary Heading: Great place, will definately be back!
Summary: While visiting our family in Yorba Linda and participating in the Disneyland Half Marathon we stayed at this Residence Inn.  We found it very nice! It has a great location (across from Target, and Pavilion grocery store, plus many restaurants) and included a very good breakfast each morning.  It is only about 20 minutes from Disneyland which made our drive in for the race very convenient! We also saw others at the hotel who ran in the races and they agreed!  The pool was refreshing after a day of sightseeing! They do even offer a light dinner on Mon, Tues, Wed evenings, but we were out and about on these nights so didn't get a chance to take advantage.  The price was a great value, our room was very spacious and clean. It also came with free wifi. It also has a workout room, and
Manager Response: Dear Christine H,  Wow! Thank you for such a wonderful and informative review. I hope that your Half Marathon was wonderful and that our accommodations allowed for a successful race.  I am glad to see all of our team members were both catering and accommodating. I know we will be seeing you back shortly!  “Suite” Regards,  Kimberly Rosales Operations Manager

Summary: Very comfy bed,nice size room,played games with my family.....fun time had by all.....liked the coffee pot and kitchen......the fact that we could order groceries was interesting but way cool.........
Manager Response: Dear Wino2011 ,  Thank you for your "suite" review!  I am glad to read that you found our amenities helpful , interesting and "way cool". We hope you had a great stay with us and an even better 30th high school reunion.  Can't wait to see you back in the future!  "Suite" Regards,  Kimberly Rosales Operations Manager

Summary Heading: Not up to the standards of Marriott
Summary: My expectations were more because it was Marriott and I had stayed earlier in other Marriott hotels which were really good but this is very poor hotel so dont go by the name. First, In my room A/C was very noisy, noise was so harsh and loud that I woke up many times in night. After paying high prices at least I expect peaceful sleep.   Second, breakfast quality was very poor - had very few options so don't expect much when you book this hotel.  Third, plates in the kitchen were not clean properly.  Marriott hotels are now out of my list and will not recommend this hotel to anyone.
Manager Response: Dear Nitin H,  Thank you for taking the time to fill out a response on  your stay with us. I want to begin my apologizing for the issues you experienced while here. Please know that we have notated these issues and are currently working to make things right.  I do understand you are a oyal member to Marriott and the last thing we would want is to present a bad representation for you. Please allow us to make things better and be able to acccommodate you again in the future.  "Suite" Regards,  Kimberly Rosales Operations Manager

Summary: Great hotel for long or short stays. Pool and hot tub were enjoyable. The hotel was sold out during our stay and we needed to upgrade to a 2 bedroom suite and they made it possible somehow. There was a family reunion here at this hotel while I was there and it seemed like the hotel was a great place for that type of thing. This hotel is a bit off the beaten path being east of Anaheim and about a 30 minute drive to Disneyland or 90 minute drive from San Diego Zoo, however the price is reasonable or if you are using points, it required less at this hotel. Both night and day manager's were great as were all the rest of the staff.
Manager Response: Dear TamiA99,  Thank you so much for your review. I am glad that you enjoyed yourself and that the team was able to accommodate your sleeping arrangements. You are correct in stating that we do get a lot of gatherings such as weddings and sports groups.   Due to the fact that our condo-like property acts more than a room and more like a residence families feel more at home at our property. We hope that you will be back soon to enjoy another relaxing stay.  "Suite" Regards,  Kimberly Rosales Operations Manager

Summary: I stayed there with bless mother 1 years ago ,it was a great hotel ,stuff was very kind and helpful with us ,swimming pool & jakozi very clean ,my room was very clean too and Mrs Marta was very kind as a cleaner , in there ,we enjoyed there , i hope , i can go there soon. Best regards
Manager Response: Dear simin s,  Thank you for your great review! I am so glad to see that you enjoyed yourself while here. I am also glad to see that Martha in housekeeping made you feel at home.  We too hope to see you back in the near future!  "Suite" Regards,  Kimberly Rosales Operations Manager

Summary: My family stayed here for a wedding weekend. It's a great location and next to a Pavilions which is great for groceries.   Lots of kids here for summer, and we heard then running through hallways and in the room above us. Try to get a top floor, but beware the painfully slow elevator or take the stairs.    We loved the one bedroom with door for baby to sleep. There was some hair in the bathroom and the shower did not drain fast which is always a little disgusting, but tolerable.
Manager Response: Dear tolket,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review on your recent stay. We appreciate all of our guest feedback beause it allows us to see what we sometimes miss.  With that being said, I would like to offer my apologies for some of the issues that you had experienced. Please know that I have passed on this information to the appropriate department heads and we are taking action.  Please feel free to contact me for any other comments or concerns. Thank you and we hope to see you soon!  "Suite" Regards,  Kimberly Rosales Operations Manager kimberly.rosales@marriott.com

Summary: I just spent four nights at this hotel and was very pleased. I arrived and couldn't get my requested room on the top floor. Ray, the front desk clerk, made it happen for me. I had to wait 10 minutes, and give up my suite for a studio, but I much prefer the top floor at any hotel. The room was plenty spacious, with a kitchen and king sized bed. The breakfast was pretty good...the selections were a bit limited but I didn't go hungry. I didn't partake in the night social hour foods but did check it out and again, the selection was limited but you wouldn't go hungry. The hotel also had a great location within walking distance of BJ's, Target, Chipotle, and the grocery store Pavillions. The pool was small but it was in the 90s and it felt great! Ray also helped me out when I couldn't
Manager Response: Dear KEE_12 ,  Wow, what a great review to read! I am so glad that my team was accommodating to your needs, especially Ray.   You are correct in mentioning that there are many eateries in the area. Some more tasty restaurants to add are El Cholo Mexican Restaurant, WoodRanch BBQ, and Islands Burgers that shares the same parking lot as us.   We can't wait to see you back, make sure to contact us in advance so we can set you up for a top floor!  "Suite" Regards,  Kimberly Rosales Operations Manager

Summary Heading: Family Friendly - Excellent Base for Disneyland and Surrounds
Summary: Stayed 7 nights in July 2014.  We always try to stay at Residence Inns because of their consistent standard of family friendly spacious two bedroom suites and hotel facilities.    This hotel is located in a quiet residential area with numerous restaurants and various stores within the immediate area.  Ask reception for a copy of their detailed (8 pages printed on both sides) list of local restaurants that also includes directions to/from the restaurants.  We found this Residence Inn significantly cheaper than hotels that are within walking distance of Disneyland. I am so glad to read what an excellent time you enjoyed here with us. We certainly do appreciate all of your future recommendations and are sure we will see you again soon!  “Suite” Regards,  Kimberly Rosales Operations Manager

From 08:00 on out, little Jr forgets that he is in

Thank you for greet review and we hope to see you back soon.  “Suite” Regards,  Kimberly Rosales Operations Manager

I hope that we can expect a return from you in the future.  “Suite” Regards,  Kimberly Rosales Operations Manager

Summary Heading: Comfortable Hotel in a Good Location
Summary: This hotel served as our base for our Disney trip. The hotel comes with the usual Residence inn facilities- Pool/Gym/Laundry. There is a Complimentary dinner on some days- but we did not use that. Great Location - there is a nearby Mall with some good stores. Safe neighborhood.  Drive to Disney and other attractions was about 15 min.

Summary: I stayed here one night while attending the NCAA West Regional in Anaheim. I do quite a bit of traveling, and is absolutely loved this place. The Queen Studio was a fabulous room...much larger than most hotel rooms that I've stayed in, very modern and elegant. The staff at the front desk were super friendly and very helpful. Breakfast was really crowded, but that's to be expected on a Sunday morning, and the selections were fabulous. I will definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Local hotel in Anaheim,  close to stores

The room had a seating area as well as a seperate bedroom.  The room was very clean.  The kitchenette area had a fridge,  dishwasher,  stove,  and microwave.  This location has an outdoor heated pool and spa which I really enjoyed.   Monday thru Wednesday they have a dinner snack.  It is nothing gourmet.  I have since stayed at another Residence Inn which has a bit better spread for food. The staff is very friendly here.  The hotel is super close to Pavillions amongst other stores in the Festival shopping  center.  Excellent location as you can walk. I will definitely stay here again when I

Summary Heading: Great serene place to stay at.

We appreciate your feedback and hope that we can soon accommodate you again!  “Suite” Regards,  Kimberly Rosales Operations Manager

The description of the room said fireplace but there was not one in my room and after a plane flight and a day at Disney was not going to switch rooms. Free Wi Fi and parking make it a good deal.

In regards to breakfast, I understand how busy the gatehouse can get, especially when we have our sports group come and visit. We definitely try and assign the appropriate amount of staff members to accommodate larger rushes.   Thank you again for your response and we hope to see you back soon.  “Suite” Regards,  Kimberly Rosales Operations Manager

The rooms are almost as nice as the photos. Although my daughter is in a wheelchair we don't require a handicap accessible room. We were so tired when we checked in that we just went with it. Location is close to shopping, restaurants, and major freeways. Rate was not discounted like first stay. Given the price I would not stay here again.

I hope you will have an opportunity to visit us again.  All the best.

The staff was friendly and the room was clean. The breakfast was decent.  We borrowed the basketball and played for a couple hours on the court.  Nothing really to complain about. Summary Heading: Excellent Stay, Excellent staff and very convenient location.
Summary: We stayed at this hotel from Jan 13 to Jan 18 as part of a wedding party of 100+ persons. They handled everything extremely well in spite of the constant demands being made of them. This hotel is very conveniently located to Hwy 91. The staff was extremely friendly. I would specially like to mention Brian who went out of his way to help us. We were driving to Vegas and Brian volunteered to look up the road conditions as it was snowing in the mountains and some roads were closed the previous day. He also looked up the address and directions to our hotel in Vegas. The breakfast was excellent. The web access was free and very fast. We were upgraded to a suite at no charge since my wife had knee surgery and was unable to walk far from the elevator. We would definitely return here

Summary: Our family (4 humans, 1 golden retriever) stayed at the Residence Inn for 3 weeks. The accommodations were clean, comfortable (excellent beds), and very convenient for an extended stay. Bathroom vanities, however, are very small, but there was always plenty of hot water. (Note: This hotel is about 10 miles from both Disneyland and John Wayne Orange County Airport and about 15 miles from Newport, the nearest beach.) Our room was really a small apartment: 2 master bedrooms, each with TV, large closet, and en suite bathroom, separated by a small living room (with a 3rd TV), fireplace, kitchen, and eating area. Free in-room internet access is provided. Complimentary breakfast is provided daily, and complimentary snacks or small suppers are also available several evenings a week.
